docs.text: com.oscar-corpus List of datasets com.oscar-corpus.english Huge French corpus from INRIA https://oscar-corpus.com/ OSCAR or Open Super-large Crawled ALMAnaCH coRpus is a huge multilingual corpus obtained by language classification and filtering of the Common Crawl corpus using the goclassy architecture.

docs.text: com.microsoft.msmarco.passage MS Marco Passage Ranking MS MARCO(Microsoft Machine Reading Comprehension) is a large scale dataset focused on machine reading comprehension, question answering, and passage ranking. A variant of this task will be the part of TREC and AFIRM 2019. For Updates about TREC 2019 please follow This Repository Passage Reranking task Task Given a query q and a the 1000 most relevant passages P = p1, p2, p3,... p1000, as retrieved by BM25 a succeful system is expected to rerank the most relevant passage as high as possible. For this task not all 1000 relevant items have a human labeled relevant passage. Evaluation will be done using MRR. Tri Nguyen, Mir Rosenberg, Xia Song, Jianfeng Gao, Saurabh Tiwary, RanganMajumder, and Li Deng. 2016. MS MARCO: A Human Generated MAchineReading COmprehension Dataset. In CoCo@NIPS. See https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking for more details List of datasets com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.collection This file contains each unique Passage in the larger MSMARCO dataset. Format is PID Passage. com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.train.run com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.train.queries com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.train.qrels com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.train information retrieval passage retrieval https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.train.withrun MSMarco train dataset, including the top-1000 to documents to re-rank information retrieval passage retrieval https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.dev.queries com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.dev.run com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.dev.qrels com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.dev information retrieval passage retrieval https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.dev.withrun MSMarco dev dataset, including the top-1000 to documents to re-rank information retrieval passage retrieval https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.eval.queries com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.eval.withrun com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.trec2019.test.queries com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.trec2019.test.run com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.trec2019.test.qrels com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.trec2019.test information retrieval passage retrieval https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking com.microsoft.msmarco.passage.trec2019.test.withrun MSMarco dev dataset, including the top-1000 to documents to re-rank information retrieval passage retrieval https://github.com/microsoft/MSMARCO-Passage-Ranking
docs.title: com.microsoft.msmarco.passage

A variant of this task will be the part of TREC and AFIRM 2019. For Updates about TREC 2019 please follow This Repository Passage Reranking task Task Given a query q and a the 1000 most relevant passages P = p1, p2, p3,... p1000, as retrieved by BM25 a succeful system is expected to rerank the most relevant passage as high as possible. docs.text: edu.stanford.glove GloVe is an unsupervised learning algorithm for obtaining vector representations for words. Training is performed on aggregated global word-word co-occurrence statistics from a corpus, and the resulting representations showcase interesting linear substructures of the word vector space. List of datasets edu.stanford.glove.6b Embeddings for 6B words in various dimensions word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.50 Glove 6B - dimension 50 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.100 Glove 6B - dimension 100 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.200 Glove 6B - dimension 200 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.6b.300 Glove 6B - dimension 200 word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.42b Glove embeddings trained on Common Crawl with 42B tokens word embeddings edu.stanford.glove.840b Glove embeddings trained on Common Crawl with 840B tokens word embeddings
docs.title: edu.stanford.glove

docs.text: GloVe is an unsupervised learning algorithm for obtaining vector representations for words. Training is performed on aggregated global word-word co-occurrence statistics from a corpus, and the resulting representations showcase interesting linear substructures of the word vector space.

docs.text: edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint The AQUAINT Corpus, Linguistic Data Consortium (LDC) catalog number LDC2002T31 and ISBN 1-58563-240-6 consists of newswire text data in English, drawn from three sources: the Xinhua News Service (People's Republic of China), the New York Times News Service, and the Associated Press Worldstream News Service. It was prepared by the LDC for the AQUAINT Project, and will be used in official benchmark evaluations conducted by National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). List of datasets edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint.apw Associated Press (1998-2000) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31 edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint.nyt New York Times (1998-2000) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31 edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint.xie Xinhua News Agency newswires (1996-2000) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31 edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint Aquaint dataset https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2002T31
docs.title: edu.upenn.ldc.aquaint

docs.text: gov.nist.trec.tipster TIPSTER is sometimes also called the Text Research Collection Volume or TREC. The TIPSTER project was sponsored by the Software and Intelligent Systems Technology Office of the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA/SISTO) in an effort to significantly advance the state of the art in effective document detection (information retrieval) and data extraction from large, real-world data collections. The detection data is comprised of a test collection built at NIST for the TIPSTER project and the related TREC project. The TREC project has many other participating information retrieval research groups, working on the same task as the TIPSTER groups, but meeting once a year in a workshop to compare results (similar to MUC). The test collection consists of three CD-ROMs of SGML encoded documents distributed by LDC plus queries and answers (relevant documents) distributed by NIST. See also https://trec.nist.gov/data/docs_eng.html and https://trec.nist.gov/data/intro_eng.html List of datasets gov.nist.trec.tipster.ap88 Associated Press document collection (1988) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC93T3A gov.nist.trec.tipster.ap89 Associated Press document collection (1989) https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC93T3A gov.nist.trec.tipster.ap90 Associated Press docs.text: TIPSTER is sometimes also called the Text Research Collection Volume or TREC. The TIPSTER project was sponsored by the Software and Intelligent Systems Technology Office of the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA/SISTO) in an effort to significantly advance the state of the art in effective document detection (information retrieval) and data extraction from large, real-world data collections. The detection data is comprised of a test collection built at NIST for the TIPSTER project and the related TREC project. The TREC project has many other participating information retrieval research groups, working on the same task as the TIPSTER groups, but meeting once a year in a workshop to compare results (similar to MUC). The test collection consists of three CD-ROMs of SGML encoded documents distributed by LDC plus queries and answers (relevant documents) distributed by NIST. docs.text: io.github.thunlp.fewrel List of datasets io.github.thunlp.fewrel.v1 FewRel 1.0 - a Few-shot Relation classification dataset unsupervised information extraction https://thunlp.github.io/1/fewrel1.html FewRel is a Few-shot Relation classification dataset, which features 70, 000 natural language sentences expressing 100 relations annotated by crowdworkers. Only the train and validation dataset are available. The test set is hidden for the leaderboard.

docs.text: org.universaldependencies.french List of datasets org.universaldependencies.french.gsd French GSD https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_French-GSD The UD_French-GSD was converted in 2015 from the content head version of the universal dependency treebank v2.0 (https://github.com/ryanmcd/uni-dep-tb). It is updated since 2015 independently from the previous source.
